rev.comment: portal is inactive, and shouldn't be noted at top of page anyway

{{portal|Stargate|Stargate-color.png}}
 
The '''Asgard''' are a [[fiction]]al highly advanced and benevolent race in the [[science fiction]] series ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' and ''[[Stargate Atlantis]]''. They are first mentioned in the episode {{sgcite|Thor's Hammer}}, and first seen in {{sgcite|Thor's Chariot}}. In the series, the Asgard gave rise to [[Norse mythology]] on Earth, as well as accounts of the [[Roswell UFO Incident|Roswell]] "[[Greys]]". Due to their technological prowess, the Asgard are critical allies in Earth's fight against the [[Goa'uld]], and later the [[Ori (Stargate)|Ori]]. The Asgard characters on the show are realized through a combination of [[puppet]]s and [[computer-generated imagery]].
The '''Asgard''' are a [[fiction]]al highly advanced and benevolent race in the [[science fiction]] series ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' and ''[[Stargate Atlantis]]''. They are first mentioned in the episode {{sgcite|Thor's Hammer}}, and first seen in {{sgcite|Thor's Chariot}}. In the series, the Asgard gave rise to [[Norse mythology]] on Earth, as well as accounts of the [[Roswell UFO Incident|Roswell]] "[[Greys]]". Due to their technological prowess, the Asgard are critical allies in Earth's fight against the [[Goa'uld]], and later the [[Ori (Stargate)|Ori]]. The Asgard characters on the show are realized through a combination of [[puppet]]s and [[computer-generated imagery]].
